definition[0]: if you assemble a large number of people or things, or if they assemble, they are gathered together in one place, often for a particular purpose
example[0]: A large crowd had assembled outside the American embassy.
example[1]: He looked around at the assembled company (=all the people who had come there).
example[2]: She had assembled a collection of her favourite songs.
definition[1]: to put all the parts of something together
example[3]: The aircraft will continue to be assembled in France.
definition[2]: to make a product by putting parts together
example[4]: The factory will assemble GM pickup trucks for sale in the Chinese market.
definition[3]: if a financial institution assembles a loan, it finds lenders who are willing to make part of the loan
example[5]: It is attempting to assemble $1 billion of credit.
definition[4]: if an organization assembles, it meets officially
example[6]: The 12,000-member International Bar Association will assemble in New York City, Sept 1923.
